intro: Pseudopeponidium tulearense, commonly known as the Tule Island melon, is a flowering plant native to the Tule Island in the Florida Keys. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, gourds, and melons. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a small, round melon with a thin, waxy skin and a sweet, aromatic flesh. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native habitat.
